elements.title: Marlborough House set (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that adultery was commonplace within Edward VII's Marlborough House set (pictured) but divorce was considered unacceptable?

elements.title: Kenny Williams (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kenny Williams set a Polish Basketball League record with 14 three-point shots in a game?

elements.title: Woman to Woman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2015 campaign Woman to Woman included a "Pink Bus" that was mocked by critics as sexist and patronising?

elements.title: Igor Stravinsky (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that composer Igor Stravinsky fled Russia after the October Revolution, but returned once in 1962 to conduct in Moscow and Leningrad, meeting Nikita Khrushchev during the visit?

elements.title: the season finale (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the season finale of The Last of Us used real giraffes?

elements.title: The Dismissal of the Greek Envoys (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nobel laureate Czesław Miłosz described the 16th-century play The Dismissal of the Greek Envoys by Jan Kochanowski as the finest specimen of Polish humanist drama?

elements.title: John Cecil Russell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite being accused of cowardice at the 28 March 1879 Battle of Hlobane, John Cecil Russell rose to become a major-general?

elements.title: a Florida TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Florida TV station claimed freeze damage to its transmitter as the reason it had to delay its first broadcast?
